meanings.definition: To perform (work) in a careless or hasty manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to slubber her homework, rushing through it without paying attention.
meanings.sent2: The chef didn't want to slubber the dish, so he took his time to prepare it perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The painter decided to slubber the job, resulting in a messy and colorful disaster.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to slubber by as she hurried through her tasks, barely noticing the details.
meanings.sent5: His attempt to slubber through the project quickly backfired when mistakes piled up.

meanings.definition: A person who is careless or sloppy in their work.
meanings.sent1: The boss was frustrated with the new slubber who kept making mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office slubber due to her consistently messy work.
meanings.sent3: The slubber's desk was always cluttered with unfinished projects and spilled coffee.
meanings.sent4: Despite his reputation as a slubber, he managed to finish the task on time.
meanings.sent5: The team had to redo the work done by the slubber, causing delays in the project.
